meanings.definition: A device that narrows a beam of particles or waves.
meanings.sent1: The collimator helped focus the beam of light.
meanings.sent2: The scientist adjusted the collimator to make the particles more concentrated.
meanings.sent3: The collimator decided to only let the particles through if they were wearing tiny hats.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a collimator, narrowing her focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The collimator acted like a gatekeeper, only allowing the particles to pass through in a straight line.

meanings.definition: A device that aligns light rays.
meanings.sent1: The collimator ensured that the light rays were all traveling in the same direction.
meanings.sent2: She used the collimator to make sure the light beams were perfectly straight.
meanings.sent3: The collimator had a knack for getting the light rays to line up for a group photo.
meanings.sent4: His guidance was like a collimator, bringing clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The collimator acted like a traffic cop, directing the light rays to their designated paths.
